message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Opioid analgesics are the most common cause of drug overdose deaths, followed by heroin. Antidepressant overdose is rare but can also be fatal. Acetaminophen overdose can cause liver failure and death, but it is not as common as opioid overdose deaths.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. According to statistics, opioid analgesics are the most common cause of drug overdose deaths in the United States. Heroin is a type of opioid, but opioid analgesics are more commonly prescribed for pain management. Antidepressants and acetaminophen overdose can also be fatal, but they are less common causes of drug overdose deaths compared to opioid analgesics.
